This is a broader issue. The main idea behind is to guide developers who are using the components / widgets whenever something went wrong due wrong parameter values which were handed in.
On the other side the principle of failing silently which is used throughout qxWeb should not suffer from this. My option would be to introduce the validation as optional feature which should be actively activated.

We already talked about it some time and it's hard to get it right for everyone. So I agree with Alex that an option with a disabled default could be a good option. If we use an environment setting for that it could be removed for the deployment build.
But this is a huge task in which we should first of all see what needs to be done. So here is a list of possible checks we could introduce:
1. Check the given arguments for its type 2. Check the given arguments for its validity 3. Check the given content of the collection
